'''Stuart Varney''' (born 1949)<ref name="voice"/> is a conservative [[British-American]] [[economic]] [[journalist]], currently working for the [[Fox News Channel]] and the [[Fox Business Network]]. Varney joined Fox News in January, 2004 as a business contributor on many shows, such as ''[[Your World with Neil Cavuto]]''. He also occasionally serves as guest host for ''Your World'' and the shows on the ''[[The Cost Of Freedom|Cost of Freedom]]'' business block. Varney graduated from the [[London School of Economics]].<ref name="voice"/> He began his broadcast journalism career at KEMO-TV (now [[KOFY-TV]]) in [[San Francisco]].<ref name="FoxNews">{{cite web|title=Stuart Varney|url=http://www.foxnews.com/bios/talent/stuart-varney/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}</ref> In 1980 he joined the [[Manhattan]] bureau of the newly founded [[CNN]] and hosted shows like ''[[Business Day]]'' and ''[[Business Asia]]''.<ref name="voice"/><ref name="FoxNews"/> From 1999 to 2001, he hosted CNNâs ''[[Moneyline News Hour|Moneyline]]'' with [[Willow Bay]] and has also worked for [[CNBC]]. Varney is a regular panel member on the FOX business analysis and stock trade investment program ''[[Cashin' In]]''.
'''Stuart Varney''' (born 1949)<ref name="voice"/> is a conservative [[British-American]] [[economic]] [[journalist]], currently working for the [[Fox News Channel]] and the [[Fox Business Network]]. Varney joined Fox News in January, 2004 as a business contributor on many shows, such as ''[[Your World with Neil Cavuto]]''. He also occasionally serves as guest host for ''Your World'' and the shows on the ''[[The Cost Of Freedom|Cost of Freedom]]'' business block. Varney graduated from the [[London School of Economics]].<ref name="voice"/> He began his broadcast journalism career at KEMO-TV (now [[KOFY-TV]]) in [[San Francisco]].<ref name="FoxNews">{{cite web|title=Stuart Varney|url=http://www.foxnews.com/bios/talent/stuart-varney/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}</ref> In 1980 he joined the [[Manhattan]] bureau of the newly founded [[CNN]] and hosted shows like ''[[Business Day]]'' and ''[[Business Asia]]''.<ref name="voice"/><ref name="FoxNews"/> From 1999 to 2001, he hosted CNNâs ''[[Moneyline News Hour|Moneyline]]'' with [[Willow Bay]] and has also worked for [[CNBC]]. Varney is a regular panel member on the FOX business analysis and stock trade investment program ''[[Cashin' In]]''.
